description: Number of Dyck paths of length 2n with nondecreasing peaks.
comments: The name refers to weakly increasing peaks. The case of strictly increasing peaks is counted by A008930. - _David Callan_, Feb 18 2004a(n) ~ 0.11997*[(3+sqrt(5))/2]^n (Theorem 2 of the Penaud-Roques paper). - _Emeric Deutsch_, Mar 05 2008Row sums of A138155. - _Emeric Deutsch_, Mar 05 2008For a constant 0.1199765127480778967304984... see A239528. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Mar 21 2014
links: Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..300
J. G. Penaud and O. Roques, Generation de chemins de Dyck a pics croissants, Discrete Mathematics, Vol. 246, no. 1-3 (2002), 255-267.
example: a(3)=4 because we have UDUDUD, UDUUDD, UUDUDD and UUUDDD, where U=(1,1) and D=(1,-1).
author: Olivier Roques (roques(AT)labri.u-bordeaux.fr)
